summary:
Botulism is a rare but serious disease caused by a toxin made by bacteria called *Clostridium botulinum*. It can start with symptoms like weakness, blurry vision, and trouble speaking. This can lead to muscle weakness all over the body, as well as stomach problems.

You can get botulism from eating contaminated food, it can grow in a baby's gut, or enter through a wound. It's not spread between people.

Prevention includes safe food handling and not giving honey to babies. Treatment uses an antitoxin and sometimes a breathing machine. With care, most people recover.
title: Botulism
